patRoon
  • Reference

Filtering of grouped features

Basic rule based filtering of feature groups.

# S4 method for featureGroups
filter(obj, intensityThreshold = NULL,
  relAbundance = NULL, absAbundance = NULL,
  interRelRGroupAbundance = NULL, interAbsRGroupAbundance = NULL,
  intraRGroupAbundance = NULL, minBlankThreshold = NULL,
  retentionRange = NULL, rGroups = NULL, formConsensus = NULL,
  compounds = NULL, repetitions = 2, negate = FALSE)

# S4 method for featureGroups
replicateGroupSubtract(fGroups, rGroups,
  threshold = 0)

Arguments

intensityThreshold

Minimum intensity. Set to 0 or NULL to skip this step.
relAbundance, absAbundance, interRelRGroupAbundance, interAbsRGroupAbundance

Minimal overal relative/absolute abundance for a feature group to be present within all analyses/replicate groups.
intraRGroupAbundance

Minimum relative abundance (0-1) that a feature group should be present within a replicate group. Set to NULL to skip this step.
minBlankThreshold

Feature groups that are also present in reference analyses (see analysis info) are filtered out unless their relative intensity is above this threshold. Set to NULL to skip this step.
retentionRange

Retention time range (in seconds). Should be a numeric vector with length of two containing the min/max values. If the max value is set to a value below 0 then no maximum retention is assumed. Set to NULL to skip this step.
rGroups

A character vector of replicate groups that should be kept (filter) or subtracted from (replicateGroupSubtract).
formConsensus, compounds

Only keep feature groups which have results in the given formulaConsensus and compounds object, respectively.
repetitions

Sometimes more feature groups may be removed by repeating filtering steps after another. Usually a value of two is enough to filter the maximum amount of feature groups.
negate

If set to TRUE then filtering operations are performed in opposite manner.
fGroups, obj

featureGroups object to which the filter is applied.
threshold

Minimal relative threshold for a feature group to be not removed. When 0 a feature group is always removed when present in the given replicate groups.

Value

A filtered featureGroups object. Feature groups that are filtered away have their intensity set to zero. In case a feature group is not present in any of the analyses anymore it will be removed completely.

Details

filter performs common rule based filtering of feature groups such as blank subtraction, minimum intensity and minimal replicate abundance. replicateGroupSubtract removes feature groups present in a given set of replicate groups (unless intensities are above a given threshold).

See also

featureGroups-class feature-grouping
